name: Catherine Colburn
text: Great people and they care for the animals

name: Lynn Langley
text: Nice helpful folks

name: John Battle
text: Very processional

name: Trish Norman
text: Great place

name: Desiree Pace
text: Stephanie was extremely kind to us when I came in to get my dog bathed and groomed. Scottie loves her! We will be back. Stephanie really went out of her way to be helpful to me and I really appreciate that!🐶😁

resp.text: Thanks so much for choosing to bring him to me! I was thrilled to have him today! I’m thankful that he is so blessed to be in your care now! 🥰

name: Renee Hulme
text: I took my dog there and they're very friendly and welcome you with open arms and your dog good people

name: S Prince
text: Very supportive of our needs, kind, and concerned for the welfare of the animals they house and care for.

name: ricky roberson
text: Friendly good service did a great job own Bama will be back

resp.text: I enjoyed him! Hope to see y’all next time! 😊

name: Patricia Sparks
text: I get my chihuahuas nails trimmed here.  They are very gentle with her.

resp.text: She’s a cutie!! Thanks for choosing us!

name: Glenda Wilhite
text: Cutest little groom shop, in business since 2004. Stephanie Hill is the owner and really cares about the dogs.  She does a great job.  She boards and rescues too.  Check out her competitive prices...

name: Maxine Moon
text: If I could do no stars I would the woman who called me about taking the cat and 2 kitchens made me feel like the worst person in the universe because I needed to remove them and proceed to tell me it was my fault that my cat had kittens. (When I got her she was a kitten herself, and I didn't feel comfortable with spaying her at the time) And then said that my mom and brother could get allergy medicine

name: Carol Gordon
text:
Tried to foster two kittens from this organization.  One turned out to be terminally ill.  Long story short I had to pay adoption fees for both kittens to pursue care for the ill kitten.
There was no misunderstanding.  Feel free to contact my vet, Susan Cardwell at Village Veterinarian Hospital, I’m sure she recalls your conversation regarding legal proceedings if she provided further care to the sick kitten while under “foster” and not purchased.  I had to deliver a check directly to your vet before we could pursue further care.

resp.text: Your statement is incorrect, this was two years ago . It was your decision to adopt the cats you offered to foster. So yes you would pay an adoption fee. We are sorry for any Misunderstanding.

name: Vashni Hollis
text: I am so glad I found them on Petfinder! Because of them we have a sweet fur baby added to our home. You can tell they really love and care about the cats they shelter. They try to find the best home that will be a perfect fit for each cat, which I respect so much. I would highly recommend them to any loving family that wants to give one of these babies a forever home!

resp.text: Thanks, so happy for you and the lucky kitty!

name: Heather Moore
text: Most dedicated folks that work 7 days a week to help cats, they always take the hard cases!!

name: Donna Fagen
text:
This place is great. They really care about animals. I have had two cat situations that they helped with. I rescued 2 un-spayed momma cats and 5 kittens from a person in my neighborhood. They took one mom and adopted out 1 kitten. I was able to find homes for the other 4.
They also rescued a momma cat living in a shed behind pizza hut with her 3 babies, one died. I had been feeding her for 4 months. They showed up and stayed for hours until they were rescued.
I called another rescue grouping Foley, ( which will remain nameless),about 4 times about the situations.They were no help at all. Heather that volunteers for ACCC called and was a big help. Other volunteers from their were a big help too.
Kudos to them for giving all of these kitties a chance. Please donate if you can. They are able to run off of donations.

resp.text: Glad we could help !

name: James Rickels
text: Susan went way out of her way to help my daughter with a stray cat that needed neutering and vet care due to an eye infection. She made arrangement for neutering at a reduced cost with a local vet and made my daughter (USA College student) with little money able to afford to keep the stray. Thank you Susan for caring so much about these cats!

name: Michelle uhle
text:
Great group- they go the extra mile when others wont!!! Volunteering with this group makes a big difference and helps homeless cats! Not enough hours in the day....  for all the needy kittens and cats to be spayed.
A great service for the community.

name: Stephanie Bassenger
text: The ACCC is a caring, devoted group of volunteers that work tirelessly to save every cat they possibly can.  They help people trap feral and stray cats for spaying and neutering.  They take in cats and kittens that need homes, even pulling from local city and county shelters.  But all this costs money, and they do ask for contributions for their TNR services, and charge a reasonable fee for adoptions.  I have gladly paid adoption fees to bring home two of my best friends.  This is a great service for our community.

name: curtis lambert
text: They have done as much as they could to help me, I've been trying to fix a feral colony & susan has always been polite to me & gave whatever help she could. But some people just don't understand how much effort goes into helping others

resp.text: We are happy to help when we can!!

name: Tameka Andrews
text:
I called about 6 kittens in a parked car and spoke with Susan who was very very RUDE!
For the place to be called a cat rescue center I can't tell by her responses. I guess my dog will EAT the kittens when they wonder into my yard.

resp.text: looking back at this remark, we want to note that all 6 kittens were taken by our volunteer and adopted out after fixed!! A shame the person who complained never corrected her remarks!!!

name: Jessika Crooker
text: These people dont truly care they do NOT call or email back

name: Mary Beth Fiser
text: I truly believe in this organization and will continue to donate.

resp.text: Thanks for any help this is 100% all volunteer group.

name: charles shook
text: they don't rescue  just another so called shelter for money

name: Pyro Roam
text: Horrible experience! Susan is very rude and DOES NOT have the best interest of her cats in mind. Extremely rude, condescending, and selfish.

name: Jenn Jones
text: Good organization.

resp.text: Thank You

name: Mary Duff
text: They care

name: Chris Underwood
text: Thanks for all you do.

name: Antrae Atkins
text: Never anwsered the phone.

name: Jennifer Roberson
text: They were very nice and helped me with our birds

name: Cynthia Sanford
text: I love birds.

name: Stephanie Morrison
text: Good food.

name: Julie Litzinger
text: A wonderful farm for all the animals.

name: Kathy Metz
text: The love we share for animals in genuine. It's all about caring for the animals and one another as a whole.

name: Judy Corbett
text: Willow farms is more than a horse rescue. They rescue people too!!  I love my Willow Farms family

name: Brenda Coker
text: Janet helped me by rescuing the most wonderful dog ever, several years ago.She was called Sable and I renamed her Rachael.she was a beautiful. She died just a couple of weeks ago due to heart disease. I did manage to give her many years of extreme happiness. I miss her so much. I am having a hard time finding another Sheltie.. Thank you Willie Farms.

name: Marta
text: Great horse rescue!

name: Candace Cheatham
text: Great Place! Great People! They really care about the horses they rescue and the boarding ones with owners! Love this place! Janet is truly amazing!

name: Beverly Boothe
text:
Willow farms was so helpful in re-homeing my 6 horses. Could not have done this without Janet's help. With her help I was able to find a new home for them just 20 miles from me and I am able to visit them. Such a blessing !!
Thank you Willow Farms !!

name: Wanda Bundy
text: I didn't hate this place nobody will call you back when you leave a message with your name and phone no.

name: Kayla
text:
She is a liar! My boyfriend and I surrendered his horse in October because we did not have the funds to continue his care for his skin condition. She made up a story & told people that I DIED and that’s why the horse was surrendered. Who does that?!

From the moment he was dropped off, her goal was to sell him for a profit. She calls him a “diamond in the rough”. A $2,500 adoption “fee”, but she turns down charitable donations from people?

I will NEVER recommend Willow Farms to anyone. The idea is there, but she is a horrible person trying to pass as a good one.

name: Kyle Landon Shoulders
text: I gave my Mustang up to WillowFarms Community to have a forever home where his condition could be treated. And know months later they are trying to turn around and sale him for $2,500.00. If that isn’t wrong then I don’t know what is! I’m glad I kept his title and because I knew how horse people can get. I wouldn’t recommend sending any horses to her. Janet will lie to you and say “oh yeah they will be fine and have a forever home here” and turn around and sell them if they are sound. Liar and a crook, but that’s what happens when you give your mustang to a nonprofit and they are desperate for money to house and flip more horses! Never send your horse here! Horse flippers! She also fabricated some lie about my fiancé dying is the reason we rehomed him!

name: Tracy Garrick
text: Mrs. Janet is a true blessing.

name: Thomas Schellinger
text: Willow Farms is an amazing place doing good work. Any support you can provide them would be greatly appreciated.

name: Becky Smith
text: Volunteers welcome and boarding for horses available. Clean facility and animals are happy and well taken care of.

name: Keith Land
text: They helped find a home for a stray jinny that someone dropped off at my house

name: Leslie Allen
text: Most friendly and helpful

name: Christina Nowak
text: Come and volunteer

name: James Hamilton
text: Love the farm

name: Emily Sandoval
text: An easy process and absolutely wonderful group of animal lovers working here. I'm so grateful to them for helping me find my newest fur baby!!

name: Mike Schneider
text: We adopted a dog from Third coast animal rescue, and could not be happier. Jackie was absolutely wonderful to work with and made the adoption very easy. Our Brewster, is everything we had been told. He is adjusting to us very well. He is a wonderful addition to our family. This organization is extremely professional and helpful and went over and above to make sure we had made the right decision on our adoption. I would highly recommend this organization if you are looking to adopt a pet.

name: Susan Cowen
text: I was approved to adopt a dog from them, but they were so uncommunicative, it took two months to actually get the dog AND I had to drive three hours away to get her myself. She was advertised as heartworm negative, but I was told she was actually heartworm positive days before I was scheduled to pick her up. I was given meds that they said were for heartworm treatment, but after taking her to my vet, found out it was only medication to manage symptoms. Be very cautious when adopting from this rescue.

name: Just Me
text:
One of the volunteers is a foster and takes care of the deaf (just like me!) and blind dogs, as if they were her own children. I highly recommend this place. Please adopt and give them a forever home. Bless your heart, Tabitha!
🤟🏽🤟🏽🤟🏽🤟🏽🤟🏽🤟🏽🤟🏽🤟🏽🤟🏽🤟🏽🤟🏽🤟🏽🤟🏽🤟🏽🤟🏽🤟🏽

name: Todd Mckerchie
text: Kind of a strange deal.... glad for what they do first and foremost. We tried to adopt a dog but you better keep every receipt of you already have a dog for heart worm meds vets etc..... ok well who in the world has receipts for a 15 year old cocker spaniel that is still kicking and has had seizures and a stroke... guess what still going. Of course we take care of our animals but good lord I’m not going to keep every record I have other things going on as well. They turned us down which is fine hope the dog gets a good home. Emailed them to check up on the dog to see if it had found a home yet, just to keep up with it that’s all. Got a reply of we already looked at your stuff and unless you have receipts you can’t adopt. Ok was just seeing if the dog got adopted chill out. I will go somewhere else from now on or just get a pure breed. They kind of left a bad taste in my mouth for rescues. We have rescues also that are in great health. Oh well

name: Brenda Hunnicutt
text: I was looking for a rescue dog

name: Deanna Weaver
text: Good

name: Gina Blount
text: Great people to work with

name: Douglas Mckee
text: Absolutely NO Help. Excuses is all You get. Very,VERY disappointed.

name: Trama Cook
text: Beautiful people! Loving my rescue Truffles!

resp.text: Thanks for the awesome review, Trama Cook! We work hard to meet expectations like yours, and we’re happy to hear we hit the mark for you. Come back and see us soon. Cheers!

name: dezmarie jones
text: I came here & was lied too 3 times. January 14, 2021 I came here and expressed my interest in a puppy VERY clearly. I told the lady ( red head w/ freckles ) Me & my friend were interested in the 2 new puppies ( Dani ( girl )  & Dominick ( boy )  ) they had just got in a couple weeks ago. They told me the dogs wasn’t available for another 2 months & I came up almost every week to create a bond with them. The freckle lady wrote my name & number down & she would give me a call when they were available. NO CALL. During my 3rd visit I was informed that Dani had been adopted by another family. I was concerned as to why she was already given a permanent family & she wasn’t available yet. So I asked questions ‘ What would I have to do so I can permanently adopt Dominick ? ‘ ... Young lady told me to fill out an application so she can give it to her manager so she would be informed on what was going on. I filled out an application for him on January 26.  On my last visit, one of the ladies I had never met came to me & informed me that they sold Dominick. She told me the family that adopted both of them had FIRST wanted Dani & had to decide whether or not they would continue to get Dominick. During the time period of them coming to an conclusion, I had already spoke to the freckle lady expressing my interest. WHY continue  to sell him to a family that had to ‘ decide ‘ on whether or not to get him & not sell him to someone who had ALREADY displayed interest. That’s foul & unprofessional.

name: Tiffany Sanderson
text:
Best kisses ever, I would be willing to guarantee. Most secure,safe feeling to exist in the whole world, in his arms most def. But babe is the meanest most outgoing to cause pain paranoid unrealistic insecure spiteful jealous , real man's man if you know what I mean. Not for me. Brings me misery outside of holding me or kissing me ( take them like u used to please) it's only hurt I'm receiving. Love you from not being around
Hopefully u can understand. Good luck with Tina Marie . Tina and Justin. Sounds good actually.

name: Sascha Easterling
text: Adopt don't Shop

name: Stephanie McBride
text: Penny Webster is genuinely dedicated to the safety and well-being of animals. I have used her as a groomer for 10 years. I know when I leave my dogs there, they are in good hands. My daughter has adopted 2 rescues from Lifeline. They are valued members of our family. I would highly recommend Lifeline and VIP Grooming.

name: Marie Noel
text: Thank you for helping me rehoming my dog. Very nice people, and understanding of hard times.

name: Dan Saulsbury
text: Great people doing awesome work for pets.

name: melody lecroix
text: Very professional,  and helpful

name: Keira Conley
text: Do you guys employ for weekend positions ? i love animals and i work during the week but i can definitely devote my weekends to the shelter!

resp.text: Hi Keira, Please go to our website and fill out the volunteer application & mention you would like to work as either a paid employee, volunteer or both.  www.lifelinepetrescue.org

name: Rocio Hostetler
text: Very good experience . Love how it was very clean and well kept . Cats were sweet as could be and the dogs looked very well keep and just good service all around. I will definitely recommend to any of my friends .

resp.text: Thanks for the great review, Rocio! The team at Lifeline Pet Rescue of North Alabama is thrilled you're happy with our service.  We appreciate all the recommendations.  Look to our website for new animals to adopt.  www.lifelinepetrescue.org

name: Lioubov Florinskaia
text: The place is small,  but they are open on the weekends and holidays,  so it was  easier for us to find the perfect pet.  And they allowed us to Foster before adopting,  so we could make sure we were the right family for the pup.

name: Christina Cunningham
text: The food is good but wait was way too long.

name: Dustin Hunt
text: Great food. And wonderful service

name: Bryan V.
text: No answer

name: Kiliaen Anderson
text: Wonderful group, currently have one of their hospice fosters and am astonished at the large amount of support provided by the group.  Behaviorist gets back to me within 24 hours and they get my foster into the vet immediately, when I've needed assistance with her condition.

name: Robin Tittle
text: Great work.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words, Robin. We really appreciate you taking the time out to share your experience with us. We count ourselves lucky for people like you.

name: Amie Hamilton
text: Great job

resp.text: Thanks for the awesome review, Amie!

name: Eddie Dodgen
text: They don't call back

name: Joe Raper
text: They really care about the animals!

name: Claude Hudson
text: This place is closed.

name: Dana St.Pierre
text: I got my lease terminated after 9 years, because I had taken in a Stray mother to be. She had 8 puppies that I helped deliver and raise for 4 mons. Since we had to move out I had to get these dogs new homes. When I took some of the dogs in for shots at the Springhill Animal Clinic they told me about Save a Stray. They placed them with a foster that kept them in a hot barn, little human interaction,  no water or food two of the three times I went to visit. After demanding they be seen for rashs, and bad skin problems the vet went and gave antibiotic shots. I was told I could not see them anymore. These people hurt my family (3kids). It was truly awful. I am not allowed to know what is happening with my dogs. So so sad.

name: Ellen Carter
text: The people who run this group are the best. If everyone was this good there would be no need for rescue groups.

name: Bobby Maghee
text: Not so happy. Offered more than what I needed.

name: Lyndall Oldeknow
text: Caring people who give a lot for the rescues.

name: David Lipscomb
text: Excellent place to consider if your looking for a cat or dog to adopt! The people who run it were very friendly and helpful. All kinds of cats and dogs who need a great home. You would be supporting a great organization who in turn could give more animals a new leash on life 🙂🐕🐈

resp.text: Thank you so much David! Thank you for supporting our program!

name: LordCaptainBamboo
text: It was very nice. Went during the Wednesday open house and adopted an adorable little kitty.

resp.text: Congratulations! We're so happy for you and thank you so much for supporting our program!

name: Michael Gray
text: Amazing people doing amazing things for these animals. They're an inspiration on how to make this world a better place!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your support Michael!

name: PictusCat
text: This is an amazing place to adopt an animal in need. It is very clean and the volunteers are so helpful!

resp.text: Thank you so much! Thank you for supporting our program!

name: Tony Camera
text: This place is awesome. They are nice, the facility is VERY clean and the staff is amazing. I will be back again in the future.

resp.text: Thank you! We so appreciate your support!

name: Rebecca Sander
text: These people are hardworking and loving individuals and what they do is amazing.

resp.text: Thank you Rebecca!

name: Sam Peacock
text: Everyone at the humane society was very sweet and polite. They take care of all the animals with loving hands. They all have the..."I love animals" look on their faces! You can tell they have the care and love to give to all the animals and that's what they do. I would recommend going to the humane society and finding a new friend to take home with you and love.

name: Paula Stewart
text: When to look at some dogs to possibly to adopt. Staff was very friendly and helpful

name: Casino Baby
text: I have adopted two animals from here over the years they are such a great place.  They are so kind and wonderful with the animals.  I believe in adopting from the shelter to help the animals that need a loving home and a second chance.  I just adopted a handicap dog and she is so loving and beautiful she's my heart.

name: Regina Buccelli
text: I adopted my revent two babies from them.  The prople are so wonderful and helpful.

name: Cove Springs Farm
text: Dogs well taken care of.  Good variety.  Low kill shelter that utilizes dog breed rescues when needed for placement of a dog

name: Shirley Cameron
text: I got my cat. The people working in there are so nice.

name: Michael Kiernicki
text: Great place to rescue your friend. Nothing like a pet.

name: Elizabeth Hester
text: They take good care of your pets

name: Arianna Harmon
text: Was supposed to come pickup a puppy for a foster to adopt situation. Called before hand to let them know when to come get it and they told me that it was going to a rescue after I was SPECIFIALLY told they didn't want it to go on a transfer and I had already held it and bought all the stuff for it. Talked to 3 people no one seemed to know why I was told that. Never seen such a dirty, unorganized place. Very disappointing.

name: school_tingz
text: SOMEONE HELP. i know this isn’t a review, but my friend’s parents captured a red eared slider turtle from their backyard and are keeping it in a small bin that’s about 10 inches long. the turtle is about 6 inches long and doesn’t have any room to move. all that’s in there is 3 inches of water with no heating lamp or basking area. the same thing happened with her last turtle, but it died. she wants to let it go, but if she does, she will get in trouble. i have offered to buy them all the necessities that the turtle needs to live a good life, but they keep turning it down. if i do, then they will yell at her. i don’t know what else to do and i don’t even know if y’all can do anything about it either, but me and her both don’t want another turtle to die because of the neglect.

name: paula nuhfer
text: We love you guys, best place ever to get a pet. Amazing caring staff. Thanks for all you do.

name: J. Sam
text: I wish I knew our babies full story but she made her way from the humane society in Gadsden all the way to Pennsylvania thank you for getting her a rabies shot. She is so sweet and kind we also love the name Tatum!

resp.text: We too wish we knew all of their stories! We just try to help them create new happy ones! Thanks for adopting! Hope Tatum is doing well!

name: Tony Walley
text: Had a great visit... the entire staff was attentive and very pleasant.  Special thanks to Abby who spent well over an hour with me she really cares about her job and knows how to make someone feel welcome.  I give the entire staff kudos

name: Dale Smith
text: Went to rescue a puppy. Smitty met us with such kindness and love. Had to get what a great puppy. I believe he is beagle and boxer mix. Awesome place to get your next pet.

name: Mizzuz Mo
text: Please go adopt Nemo! They won't tell me how he's doing. I'm sure he's scared. He's just a baby. Well, a really big and rapidly growing baby--but still a baby! He loves to play and recently began to dig holes outside! He's 7 months old today. He needs some one who knows how to train him because he can get really excited when he's happy and we could not afford professionals. He's kept in crate overnight from 10pm to 6/7 am. He eats 3x daily 6-8a, 1p, 6-7p. Purina puppy chow. He's walked one hour after eating. And will scratch at door if he needs to "do his business". He's gonna get really big, but he's a sweetheart. He's a lab/pit mix. He received 2 rounds of puppy shots, dewormed, chewable nexguard flea & tick/heartguard for heartworm prevention at Gadsden Pet Clinic. He's a whole lot of joy and much work for a family that includes a baby the same age as him. We only allowed him in the living room as he grew and we were in a different part of house doing school work. Husband works 6 days a week and with an infant and 3 little ones I was exhausted. I don't think he was as happy as he could be. We miss him(didn't know I'd miss him like this😢). We love him, we want him to be happy, and hope he finds his forever home with a more experienced person or family who can give him lots of attention, exercise, training, and much love. He really is a good dog. #Nemo

name: Abigail
text: I first visited this humane society to look for a dog to adopt. My first impression was that the staff was decent, but they were not very helpful as it was my first time adopting and I did not know how the process worked. After waiting around for the staff to acknowledge me, I was informed where the dogs were, and was told I could to go back and look at them. I immediately liked one of the dogs, so I told the staff that that was the one that I wanted to adopt. They said they would hold it for me, and that it may take a few days, and that they would call me when the dog was ready. After a week of waiting for a call, I called the shelter to see about the dog. They transferred me to two numbers, telling me they were busy, and then no one answered. This happened three times within two days, and then no one answered every time we called after that. I went to the shelter to see what the issue was, and one of the staff told me that a rescue that re-homes dogs throughout the country came and got her to take her to a no kill rescue to  save space in their shelter. They had plenty of room, and why would they give them to a shelter to save space to re-home in another state ,if there was someone interested in adopting him in their shelter here? I was very disappointed in their service.

name: Joseph Evers
text: Very helpful and nice staff, I feel like they really care for the animals and I highly recommend this location.

name: Amanda Elrod EA
text: Thank you guys so much for finding and taking care of Choo Choo, you guys are the greatest 🤗🤗🤗🤗🤗

name: Nena Stephens
text: They are NOT a no kill shelter. Just want to clear that up, as some have stated in their reviews. Was told by an employee yesterday that they are a traditional shelter and the only no kill shelter nearby is in Boaz.

name: Jennifer Stango
text: The staff are super helpful and friendly. I just wish I could take all of the animals home.  It breaks my heart there are so many sweet animals there waiting for a home.

name: Frankie Diego
text: It's a nice place to adopt a New family because my new dog became a new family member who is now happy to be with us

name: mason Rulez
text: My dog that was stolen was adopted out because I didn't find the facebook page In time for her to come home now I have no information of her whereabouts or.if it was even her

name: Faith Gables
text: I’ve been looking arround for a kitten for a while now and I visited this shelter to take a look. I found a kitten on the first visit and was interested but they decided to close two hours early so I only was able to take a quick look at the kitten. I took home an aplication and returned it a few days after but when I looked at the kitten again she and her siblings had a SEVERE respitory infection. One of her siblings was sneezing so hard there was blood everywhere! The staff was not attentive and distracted by her boyfriend. We had to inform her of the sick kittens. Moments before she had informed me the kittens were ready to go home with a family. They didn’t even know the cats were sick! The windows were unwashed and covered in kitten mucus.I looked into the cat room and one of the adult cats was limping and would not put any weight on her front paw. I’m very disappointed because I have adopted two pets from here when I was a kid,and I once volunteered here regularly when I lived in this state. This place used to be great. I do not by any means mean to be hateful or rude but I would not adopt an animal from here. All the animals are in poor condition and all the cats had respitory infections. I really would like to see improvement in the future because this place used to be great.:(  on the other hand if you are looking for a healthy animal and a shelter with great caring staff and great reviews try Rainbow City Animal Shelter. The staff gave me a tour after asking what I was looking for. I was introduced to every cat. The staff also spent enough time with the cats to now their unique personalities and preferences. I was very impressed. They were amazing and helped me adopt a healthy flame point Siamese kitten! 11/10 would recommend.

name: Jacquelyn Irby
text: I adopted Aurora August 3, 2018. I shortened her name to Rori, and she goes to work with me everyday. I am a caregiver and my patients just love her and she loves them. She is the best fur-baby ever. Smart, funny, and very loving!!! Oh yes, she talks back to me... very vocal. I love her so much, and she has been a huge help to me as my service dog!!! Rescuing an animal is very gratifying. Everyone that is in want of a furr-baby should check out the shelter first. The babies the are waiting to pick you for their forever mom or dad!!! <3 < 3

resp.text: Thank you for your outstanding review! We are so happy for you and Rori, I hope she touches many lives along the way. Thank you for adopting and happy tails to both of you!

name: Madelyn Chambers
text: The workers here are always so sweet, and seem to genuinely care about animals.

name: Jason
text: We adopted our dog from them 3 years ago. They we're very friendly and courteous. To this day, if we have questions, they take their time to answer them and hello any way they can

name: charli abbott
text: They were wonderful and were affordable enough so that I could get my puppy Daisy fixed. They took good care of her. Thank you

name: jan colley
text: We love our new family member , SADIE. The facility was clean, employee's were friendly, and helpful.

name: ChytheKing 7787
text: This is a no kill shelter which is amazing. And the staff is really nice

name: sinbadicus
text: Very friendly staff with great knowledge

name: Jody Brown
text: This local Human Society is contracted through several municipalities locally due to the fantastic work their team of professionals provide and rescue along with adoption efforts. Friendly staff all the way around and I seem to see nothing but a prosperous future for this organization and the people involved in it now! Great things are really happening here.

name: Franklin
text: Adopted 2x from here and most recently this wk. Excellent information from staff who strive to maintain a clean facility. Not everyone can adopt and not all should be allowed. i'm a proud partner & encourage animal lovers to check out this agency. Also follow the web cam & agency fund raisers.

resp.text: Thank you for adopting and also for the kind words! We appreciate your support, we couldn’t do it alone!

name: Dora Lesley
text: I love animals. I hope the animals get a loving family.

name: Tammy Smith
text: Hello, update on Peanut Smith, he had surgery to remove tumor on neck and surgery to fix tail. He is on some medication, but doing great, he goes back to the Dr.(vet) in one week for follow up. My brother an I figured about a year and 3 months since we last seen him. The Dr.(vet) said he had been thru it. For sure that's an understatement. I am so very thankful to you and your staff for helping us reunite. We will visit once we are good and healthy..see you soon..Thank you again so very much.

resp.text: Such great news! Happy tails to all of you and thanks for 5 stars!

name: William Mullins
text: Smell bad, not clean

name: Carla Pnkerton
text: The staff is rude, and they don't answer their phones. They aren't helpful at all.

name: Amber Thompson
text: Was in there around veterans day. There was this older woman there making a scene about why she couldn't have a dog. The people at the society were very nice and informative about the fact that they would not let her take in this dog without having the dog at their home neutered. Which is very understandable.  I really appreciate that they would go to such lengths to keep the pet population down. The older lady was very rude and stormed out of the building disappointed. I hate that people like that exist in this world.

name: Abi Carter
text: If I could give a negative rating I would. What I witnessed was beyond horrific. The dogs are severely neglected. I looked at smaller breeds and every single one of them were malnourished. They looked as if they had not eaten in months, their ribs were showing horribly. Every single one of them also suffered from kennel cough so bad that they could not run or breathe without coughing non stop. I also witnessed a worker literally throw a dog under her arm like it was a sack of flour instead of a living animal. These poor babies have already had a rough life and they are not getting the treatment they need/deserve. I will not adopt from this place EVER.

name: Valarie Hudson
text: I love this place. The animals are well taken care of and everybody was friendly.

name: Kartr Higgins
text: Great place!  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  They helped us adopt a great cat.

resp.text: Thanks for your review! Hope your fur baby is doing well!

name: Sarah Reaves
text: My little baby is fixed and home and very well taken care of

name: Ryan Adams
text: Friendly staff

name: Olivia Rager
text: loving and caring staff! I volunteer a few days a week and the staff cares so much about the animals as if they are their own.

name: Hope Meeks
text: As clean as you can expect an animal rescue to be. The people were knowledgeable and friendly.

name: Skyler Mayo
text: Today I took my dog maylle here she is such a wonderful dog I wish I could have kept her but sadly I couldn't I hope y'all help her find a amazing home were she can be loved and treated well

resp.text: We are very sorry you couldn't keep her, we will take good care of her and find her a great home!

name: Michael Russo
text: Come save a pet's life..great people to help you...

name: Margaret Gilpin
text: Adopted my kitten. Very clean and organized facility. Awesome people who care and love animals.

resp.text: Thanks for your review and hope your fur baby is doing well!

name: Marlene Trusler
text: Such helpful patient people, Sarah and Lisa were such an amazing help

resp.text: Thank you! We consider ourselves blessed to work alongside those two ladies!

name: Mary Gilliland
text: Did not even help me with a cat that had kittens that was a stray.... NOT A HELP AT ALL

name: james adams
text: Staff is very helpful .  They are eager to assist you on your search for your forever pet. You can bring your current pet to see how they get along wiith your candidates.

resp.text: Thanks for the great rating!

name: Daniel Watts
text: Great people who care about animals and they're well being

name: David Pearson
text: Last week i done the hardest thing ever, I had to put up our puppy up for adoption a puppy that we rescue at birth. But after 5 months we felt it would be best to find her a good home a home with a bigger yard an someone that's younger. She was house broken all shots an chipped a great puppy. So today I just wanted to check to make sure they found her a good home see if I could bring her toys an if she was still there have some play time. They open at 10 am I call no answer I leave message no call back I call again for the next 2.5 hrs no answer. So I drive to the center went to the front desk an the lady ask if she could help me I said yes I drop off my puppy an I was-------- she cut me off an told me once I signed that paper she could not give out any info. Thanks for making me feel worst an all I wanted to do was to see what else I could do.

resp.text: Mr. Pearson, we are so sorry you had to give your puppy up. We understand things happen. That is why we are here, and as I type this, we have already taken in 11 since opening at 10am. Fortunately, we average about 50 adoptions each month and try our absolute best to save everything we can. Because of the overwhelming number of animals that come in to the staff of 8, it was set forth years ago that while you are welcome to stop in or check Facebook for those up for adoptions, the board and staff have the policy in place that once surrendered, we cannot personally discuss updates. With such a small team and upwards of 4000 souls coming in each year, it would be impossible to speak with every family. We hope that you are off to a great Summer and that you will consider adoption in the future. We, along with other area shelters, appreciate those that come back, once situations change. Have a safe Summer, sir.

name: Tia McDaniel
text: Ten outta ten I got my dog there and volunteered there for years and glad to say they always made me feel welcomed and it's the place to go if you ever want a furry friend(s). And a big thanks for Sister.

resp.text: Thanks for adopting and volunteering! You are welcome anytime! We couldn’t do it without our volunteers!

name: Christie King
text: This group of staff and volunteers are so passionate about every animal that comes into the shelter.  I love what they are doing for the furbabies of Etowah County!  Call them to adopt.

name: Tracy Patton
text: I came in with my daughter to adopt yesterday veterans day...We found a very sweet puppy that you call Taz she played in yard with Taz for an hour..and fell in live..We were totally and completely disappointed when we were informed we could not adopt him because my for yr old house dog wasn't neutered...Thus really broke her heart. She is a police officer and serves in National guard.. 20 years old no children and wanted and found this puppy. That puppy would have had the.most loving home because of her companionship and she would have loved to have this puppy to help her overcome her stress from the job as well as lonliness....I was totally taken back by this and I wonder what better of home than with a caring and serving child that has so much to offer..if that isn't a acceptable home for this pup I don't  know what is.. very disappointed and sad..

resp.text: Mrs. Patton, we so appreciate you coming in. The policies set forth in the bylaws and by the governing board offer some flexibility but not much, regarding spay and neuter. We are going through Google to see our reviews and apologize for the late response time. We appreciate you making the decision to adopt. Taz is actually living the life in South Carolina. While we don't get to see Taz as much, we do get Facebook updates. Fat and sassy for sure! Hope your baby is doing well, too. Have a safe Summer.

name: Sherri Brothers
text: I have loved these wonderful folks for a long time . they have saved many furkids..

name: Dixon Miller
text: Enthusiastic, caring staff and a clean, modern facility. Nothing here that is not to love.

name: Flakeaze
text: So many cute dogs

name: Melissa Conner
text: Nice clean place everyone was real nice

name: Abigail Jenkins
text:
I voulenteer every Saturday! Very fun!!!
I love playing with the animals!

name: Sharita “Spot” Johnson
text: Great employees

name: Bobby Perkins
text: Really nice and helpful staff

name: Morgan Bond
text: Help this dog showed up at my house and I can’t keep it

name: Terri Findley
text: They act like they really don't like animals and don't call and ask for help you can forget it.

name: Char Pollitz mathews
text: Will not help mistreated animals very unfriendly hate this place

resp.text: Mrs. Mathews, we are sorry to hear you feel this way. Please tell us a little more about what we were unable to help you with. We average over 50 adoptions a month, send another 20 or more on transport and rescue, assist all of Etowah County with paying for spaying and neutering, work with local city and county leaders to support local and state legislation for animal advocacy, and offer food assistance to residents in need. We also shelter animals from within the city limits of Gadsden and Attalla. We see your other reviews are Jefferson County way. If this was meant for the Gadsden shelter, please let us know how we can help you. Enjoy your Summer!

name: J. Rain
text: Too small

name: Mark Collier
text: Nice and clean

name: Eric Carroll
text: People with ALOT of HEART. They will help when no one else will.

resp.text: Thank you Eric, we try our best to help in any way we can!

name: Carolyn OBrien
text: The most "inhumane" organization ever encountered and pulling only a pathetically small percentage of animals from Bartow Co with whom they are contracted to help pull and save.  No at all a "humane" organization.

resp.text: Mrs. OBrien, thank you for the review. Unfortunately, you may have the wrong shelter. We are unaware of Bartow County or who they contract with. We are in North Central Alabama in Gadsden and serve as a shelter to the community. We assist residents within the city limits of Gadsden and Attalla. There are three other shelters in our county, but none of them partner or service the county you reference. Hope this helps. Have a safe Summer!

name: Tracie Wiggs
text: 5 stars

name: B Johnston
text: Great cause

name: Phillip Wilson
text: We donated pet food

name: Charity Haney
text: I want to adopt them all!!!

resp.text: Thanks for the awesome rating!

name: Dylan Spencer
text: Very disappointed of called this facility over 20 times since i left there this nor no g with no response very poor customer service

resp.text: Dylan, THANK You for adopting this year! We are not sure what extensions you left messages on but hope you can narrow it down, so we can check into the phone and service system. The adoption also tried to contact you this morning, so please let them know details when you guys connect. THANK YOU FOR ADOPTING!

name: Justin King
text: Doing best they can

resp.text: Thanks for the review!

name: Dillon Fuller
text: I tried bringing kittens down to put up for adoption but they wanted $50 just to take them

resp.text: Mr. Fuller, the bad news is that we only take in from within the city limits of Gadsden and Attalla at no charge, due to contracts that the cities cover for their residents. The good news is that we are one of few shelters that still service ALL areas. Because we are a stand alone nonprofit and not owned by government, we do ask for an out of area fee to offset the costs associated with care and vetting for the over 4000 needing help, yearly. We always encourage residents from other areas to spay and neuter their pets and directly seek assistance within their areas. Thank you for checking with us. Do let us know if you still have the Mother cat. We offer to pay most of the spay fee. You do have to reside in Etowah County, but it is available, thanks to donors that believe in the program.

name: David Martin
text: It's amazing

name: Ralph Pruitt
text: Want answer the phone.
